alert.note: Alert for Furnas; Gosper (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 7:40PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Gosper and western Furnas Counties through 830 PM CDT... At 740 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Eustis to near Bartley to near McCook. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cambridge around 750 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Holbrook, Wilsonville and Arapahoe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Nebraska.
